sub_pages.sub_page_description: The Verge is about technology and how it makes us feel. Founded in 2011, we offer our audience everything from breaking news to reviews to award-winning features and investigations, on our site, in video, and in podcasts.
The Verge is an ambitious multimedia effort founded in 2011 to examine how technology will change life in the future for a massive mainstream audience.

The Verge was founded in 2011 in partnership with Vox Media, and covers the intersection of technology, science, art, and culture. Its mission is to offer in-depth reporting and long-form feature stories, breaking news coverage, product information, and community content in a unified and cohesive manner. The site is powered by Vox Media's Chorus platform, a modern media stack built for web-native news in the 21st century.

sub_pages.sub_page_description: The Verge is about technology and how it makes us feel. Founded in 2011, we offer our audience everything from breaking news to reviews to award-winning features and investigations, on our site, in video, and in podcasts.
A primer on how we review products and score them

Artificial intelligence is more a part of our lives than ever before. While some might call it hype and compare it to NFTs or 3D TVs, AI is causing a sea change in nearly every part of the technology industry. OpenAI’s ChatGPT is arguably the best-known AI chatbot around, but with Google pushing Gemini, Microsoft building Copilot, and Apple working to make Siri good, AI is probably going to be in the spotlight for a very long time. At The Verge, we’re exploring what might be possible with AI — and a lot of the bad stuff AI does, too.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The Steam Deck has finally been surpassed — by a fork of Valve’s own experience - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Bazzite can convincingly transform a Windows handheld into a true Steam Deck rival, and it shines on the Asus ROG Ally X.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Steam Deck OLED, ROG Ally and more: all the news about the handheld PC revolution - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Valve’s Steam Deck is a Switch-like handheld device that lets you play your Steam games on the go — and it’s not alone. You can read all of our coverage of it and rivals right here.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Report: Valve is secretly building a Switch-esque portable gaming PC - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Nearly a decade after introducing an ill-fated line of Linux gaming PCs dubbed “Steam Machines,” PC gaming giant Valve is reportedly trying its hand at hardware again — with its own handheld gaming computer a la the Nintendo Switch.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: This tiny gaming laptop has two keyboards, one beneath the other. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: I have a hard time believing this OneGx2 could be comfortable to hold, but major kudos if OneXPlayer can figure it out! I’m currently toying with a similar GPD machine that hides its joysticks beneath little covers, but a split keyboard and sticks beneath a full keyboard is something else.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Valve finally made a white Steam Deck that you can actually buy - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Valve has finally decided to release the normally black Steam Deck handheld gaming PC in white. The limited-edition white model is going on sale for $679 on November 18th at 3PM PT / 6PM ET.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Lenovo accidentally confirms Legion Go S yet again — with a budget AMD chip. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: If you read my Lenovo Legion Go review and thought “that but less expensive and cumbersome,” Videocardz may have good news: the unannounced smaller “Legion Go S 8ARP1” now has a firmware update for its unannounced AMD Rembrandt APU. That’s a last-gen architecture that should be more affordable than AMD’s “Extreme” line.  Also, though: the original Legion Go is its best price ever right now.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The Ayaneo 3 will have an OLED screen option and upgraded triggers. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Ayaneo has revealed some specs for its next Windows handheld. The Ayaneo 3 will be available with either a seven-inch LCD or OLED HDR display, and an AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 or Ryzen 7 8840U processor. The handheld will introduce an extra set of buttons on the back, plus lock switches to reduce the travel of its triggers for FPS players.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Don’t expect a new Steam Deck to drop each year. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Valve Steam Deck designer Lawrence Yang set some release timeline expectations in an interview with Reviews.org: That checks out given we already knew a next-gen Steam Deck might not arrive before 2026.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: 8BitDo's Ultimate Bluetooth gamepad is a $41.99 Amazon lightning deal. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The best PC/Switch/Steam Deck gamepad I've ever used. Top-tier joysticks and wireless, great battery life, gyro, and rumble, convenient dock, can wake Switch and/or OLED Deck wirelessly from couch. Comfy, too! If it had swappable battery and saved multiple Bluetooth pairings, it'd truly be Ultimate. Note: If you buy something from this link, we might get affiliate revenue.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The best SSD upgrades for your Steam Deck, according to actual testing. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Unlike every other “Best Steam Deck SSD” written story I’ve found, Tom’s Hardware actually put them to the test — 16 drives in total.  Most offered similar results! The Crucial P310 and Corsair MP600 Mini (with new Phison E27T controller) slightly stood out on performance and battery life — but not temperature.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: MSI’s Claw successor handheld with Lunar Lake isn’t coming till next year. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The Claw was an embarrassment, and MSI quickly announced successors with Intel’s new Lunar Lake instead. But though MSI originally said the “MSI Claw 8 AI Plus” should arrive September, it’s now telling ComputerBase it won’t launch till CES in January.  Just to be clear, the ROG Ally X put the final nail in the original Claw’s coffin. Friends don’t let friends buy an original Claw.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The OLED-toting Zotac Zone handheld is indeed available for preorder — just not in the US. - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: We held off on a story ’cuz we couldn’t initially find it on preorder, but here it is at Scan UK and Overclockers UK and Germany’s CaseKing, for example. What about the US? Zotac told Tom’s Hardware it isn’t offering preorders here. Can’t imagine it beats ROG Ally X for the same $800 with a much smaller battery inside... but twin trackpads and OLED intrigue me!

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Asus ROG Ally X review: the best Windows gaming handheld by a mile - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The Asus ROG Ally X has the most comfortable grip, the smoothest gameplay, and the longest-lasting battery among Windows gaming handhelds.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: MSI’s Claw handhelds get an Intel Lunar Lake do-over with a $799 starting price - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The MSI Claw 7 AI Plus and Claw 8 AI Plus are now available in preorder and shipping on December 25th, with 32GB of RAM and Intel Lunar Lake CPUs.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Did MSI accidentally let slip when its new Claw handhelds will ship? - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The Claw 8 AI Plus and Claw 7 AI Plus have appeared on Amazon for $899 and $799 respectively, and will ship Dec. 25th and Dec. 1st respectively, per Videocardz... but the listings seem to have been stripped of those crucial details now. MSI already announced both handhelds in June as quick followups to the embarrassing original. Lunar Lake could bring better performance and battery, but apparently not pricing.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Leak: Valve is making a Steam Controller 2 and a ‘Roy’ for its Deckard - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Valve watcher Brad Lynch claims a Steam Controller 2 — codename “Ibex” — will genuinely go on sale, two years after Valve agreed it’d like to make one.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Lenovo Legion Go S leak shows renders of the cheaper handheld gaming PC - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Leaked renders appear to show the Lenovo Legion Go S, a cheaper version of its PC gaming handheld rumored to start at around $399.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The discontinued Steam Deck LCD is on sale - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The 512GB Steam Deck LCD is on sale for $337 ($112 off) as part of the Steam Autumn Sale, which is the best price we’ve seen on the handheld gaming PC since September.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Asus, Samsung, and MSI announce world’s first 27-inch 4K OLED 240Hz monitors - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The first 27-inch 4K OLED 240Hz monitors are arriving soon. Asus, Samsung, and MSI are ready with them, but nobody has a release date or price yet.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: US sanctions Russian group over AI-generated election disinformation - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The US Department of Treasury has imposed sanctions on groups in Iran and Russia for attempting to interfere with the 2024 presidential election.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: LG’s lightweight Gram laptops get new Intel chips and offline AI features - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: LG is upgrading its lightweight Gram laptop lineup with Intel Arrow Lake and Lunar Lake processors, plus LG AI software with both cloud and local offline features.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Apple promised next-gen CarPlay in 2024, so where is it? - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Apple’s dashboard-wide CarPlay still hasn’t shown up in a vehicle more than two years since it was announced, despite Apple’s site still proclaiming it will in 2024.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Apple could bring its ‘Pro’ OLED displays to the entire iPhone 17 line - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: For months, rumors have suggested that Apple will put 120Hz ProMotion OLED displays on all of its iPhone 17 models, rather than just its high-end “Pro” phones.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: LG’s 2025 gaming monitor lineup includes a bendable 5K2K OLED - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: LG is introducing the UltraGear GX9 series of gaming monitors at CES 2025. There are two 45-inch 21:9 5K2K OLED displays — and one of them is bendable.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Is your iPhone sharing photos data with Apple by default? - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Apple compares data from users’ iPhone pictures to enable the ability to identify landmarks in user photos and allow users to search for those photos with the landmarks’ names.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Apple TV Plus is free to stream this weekend - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Apple is offering its Apple TV Plus streaming service for free from January 4th through 5th.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: A two-pack of refurbished Blink Outdoor 4 cameras is more than half off right now - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: You can grab a pair of refurbished Blink Outdoor 4 cameras for 55 percent off today. 8Bitdo’s Ultimate Controller for the Nintendo Switch and Anker’s 321 charger are also on sale.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The 2TB WD_Black C50 Xbox expansion card hits record low $190 - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The 2TB WD_Black C50 expansion card for Xbox Series X / S is down to a record low $190. You can also get Umbra’s Nanoleaf-powered Cono smart lamp for 20 percent off.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: LG’s brilliant B4 OLED TV is on sale with a $50 gift card for its best price ever - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: LG’s entry-level B4 OLED is available for $200 off at Best Buy. The latest iPad and Twelve South’s MagSafe-ready Butterfly charger are also down to an all-time low.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Best iPad deals for December 2024 - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Whether you’re looking to save on the 2024 iPad Pro and iPad Air or find bargains on the latest iPad Mini or entry-level iPad, we’re keeping tabs on the best deals.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: iRobot’s mop-equipped Roomba Combo j7 Plus is nearly matching its best price to date - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: iRobot’s Roomba Combo j7 Plus starts at $669 ($331 off) at Wellbots. The Beats Solo 4 and Aqara G4 Video Doorbell  are also on sale.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The Backbone One with USB-C is just $50 for today only - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The second-gen Backbone One with USB-C is 50 percent off for one day. Other deals bring the Logitech G203 Lightsync gaming mouse and an Anker charger under $20.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The PS5 disc drive is back in stock, but only for GameStop Pro members - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: GameStop Pro members can buy a PlayStation 5 disc drive for $79.99 right now, which is the standard MSRP. However, it does require a $25 premium rewards membership.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Sony is still slashing prices on consoles, controllers, and more for the holidays - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Sony is discounting PlayStation 5 consoles, DualSense controllers, and various accessories as part of its ongoing holiday sale. You can also save on a year of Mint Mobile.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Last call: 176 Cyber Monday deals you can still get - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Cyber Monday is over, but many deals are running over time. There are tons of tech deals you can still get on TVs, laptops, earbuds, Apple devices, games, and more.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: What time do Black Friday deals start at Amazon, Walmart, and other retailers? - The Verge
sub_pages.sub_page_description: Holiday shopping starts well ahead of November 29th, aka Black Friday. Many retailers have already rolled out early deals online, but here’s when the official sales start.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: The 260 best Cyber Monday deals as chosen by our expert reviewers and editors - The Verge

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Our $1 billion investment in a new UK data centre
sub_pages.sub_page_description: People and businesses in every corner of the UK rely on data centres to power helpful services like Search, Maps, YouTube, Workspace and Google Cloud. As more people tap into the opportunities created by the country’s digital economy and we unlock new ways for AI-powered technologies to boost productivity, fuel creativity, improve health outcomes and unlock scientific discoveries, it’s vital that we invest in the technical infrastructure needed to support innovation and tech-led growth.One of the ways that we’re doing this is by investing $1 billion in a new UK data centre in Waltham Cross, Hertfordshire. The 33-acre site will create construction and technical jobs for the local community. Once complete, this investment will bring crucial compute capacity to businesses across the UK, supporting AI innovation and helping to ensure reliable digital services to Google Cloud customers and Google users in the UK and abroad.

sub_pages.sub_page_title: Pixel FC: Helping close the visibility gap in women’s football
sub_pages.sub_page_description: The Women’s football tournament last summer was the most-watched ever, with more than 365 million estimated viewers globally. In the UK alone, 17.4 million people tuned in to witness the Lionesses’ historic win against Germany.*However, research by Google Pixel and the Women’s Sport Trust revealed that despite record-breaking broadcast audiences and media coverage for women’s football in the 2022/23 season, there are still strides to be made to help the women’s game get the visibility it deserves and give fans more of the content they love. Between April and May 2023, only 2% of print media football coverage and 6% of television football news mentions in the UK were dedicated to women’s football compared to the men's game.*Supporting female-led coverage with Pixel FCAs the Official Mobile Phone and Earbuds Partner of The Football Association, we are committed to play a part in helping the game progress. To this end, today we launched Pixel FC, an initiative that aims to increase visibility for women’s football. Pixel FC is a collective of creators and presenters who share this mission and we’ll be equipping them with the tools, platform and investment needed to produce the coverage the game deserves.And who are the members of Pixel FC? Alex Bailess, Abbi Summers, Mollie & Rosie Kmita and Samantha Miller — all talented presenters and creators who love the game but don’t always have the best possible access to resources to cover these games consistently.4 ways we’re working with the FAAlong with supplying them with the latest Pixel devices, this is how we’re working with The FA to support the presenters and creators behind Pixel FC:Providing pitchside access and time with players so they can produce the best content.Covering travel and expenses to Australia and New Zealand to report on this summer’s tournament in all its glory.Committing to achieving fair and equal pay for all Pixel FC members.Continuing to work with media partners across the industry to help grow women’s football across the board and the profile of creators and presenters covering it, starting with Footballco to increase women’s football tournament visibility on GOAL, the world’s biggest football website.And our ambition for Pixel FC does not end with the summer tournament; it’s a long term commitment with more names joining the roster soon.*All stats are sourced from WST Report ‘The Gender Parity of UK Football Coverage 2022-23 Season’.
